message:
SYSTEM: Terminology_in_ontologies.pdf: Página 26
26
Some definitions
• Thesaurus: Organized controlled vocabulary of terms and their relations (hierarchical, 
equivalence, associative), that can be applied in a subject domain.
• Computational lexicon: Repository of lexical information developed by several 
applications in the field of NLP technologies
• Lexical DB: Lexicon organized according to a data model that allows the storage , 
retrieval and modification of data.
• Semantic network:  A network that represents semantic relations between concepts
• Topic map: A collection of topics, associations and scopes thet may exist in some 
interchange format (ISO/IEC 13250)
• Ontologies  for linguistic purposes: 
– Represent linguistic information, related to the semantics of the grammatical units
– Relate specific linguistic information with other kinds of information
(phonologic, morphologic, syntactic, semantic and pragmatic)
